ratings.comment: She is very passionate about what she does, but she can come off a bit unclear at times. TA is what makes or breaks it. Reading is worthless (aside from the simon wiesenthal case study at the beginning). Just read lecture agendas and go to section for success.

Claudia is a very confusing professor and teaches a very confusing class. I have never dreaded a lecture more in my life. This class is very confusing and Claudia is sometimes hard to hear and understand in general. The readings are awful and are not really necessary. Rely on her agendas to get you through which she sends out in email before class

Very hard to understand and follow! Nice lady very intelligent, willing to answer questions and stop to explain things but lectures were not engaging at all. As a business student I hated this class, attendance taken every class. TA was very helpful and pretty much got me thru the class. Exams not too difficult, not hard to get a B.

Very bad professor. I took this class and didn't learn much then read philosophy textbooks later and learned a great deal about what we were talking about that she didn't mention. This includes utilitarianism and Epicurus and Nietzsche. I learned more from my TA, take this class with someone else. Highly recommend the class though.

Slowly realized that doing the readings was useless. She writes all the lecture notes down before class, so you spend the first 15-20 minutes scribbling them down with no idea what's really going on, and feel the same way as lecture progresses. Discussions prior to the exams summed up the important things to know, Wikipedia helps with the rest..meh

Wise, friendly, and fascinating. I liked how she graded essays. If your argument has holes, she'll point them out. She made me think more critically about the ideas from the reading. Consequently, I learned not just about ethics, but also about arguing and writing in general. We had a lot of fascinating discussions. Take this class.

Lectures were very interesting. She's been teaching the class for 30-40 years and definitely knows her stuff. Not very hard; lots of reading but you'll be able to do well even if you don't read all of it. The TA, Eric Senseman, was great. He grades all the exams, so you really want to know what he wants you to write and not what Card wants.

Such a sweet lady! Lectures were interesting, but contained unnecessary detail. 3 Blue book exams! Gives great review sheets that prepare you well. TA ERIC was AMAZING and made the course easy to understand!

TA grades exams; tailor to them, not Card. Lectures are interesting but not extremely helpful-she's too smart and goes off on tangents a lot. Not hard to do well, but not an easy A. Minimal outside work; blue books exams make up grade 30/30/40

Claudia Card is brilliant and anything but conventional (rain slickers and mismatched dresses to class). She can is very tough to follow at times because of the speed at which she presents and the presentation of the material (Written in no particular order up on the blackboard. TA Danielle Wylie was awesome. Summarized the course material excellen
Lectures were boring and semi confusing. TA Gina S was amazinnnng! Prof. Card is nice. Essay exams. Don't take unless you have to.

I really enjoyed this class. The readings were interesting but her lectures could be hard to document with the way she writes notes on the board. The outlines and study questions help a ton for exams.

She is pretty great. A surprisingly humble woman for all her achievements, she remains sharp as ever (she's getting up there in age).  She is clearly biased in a stereotypically "feminist" way, although this is understandable because she probably lived through much of the burgeoning of second wave feminism, and hence encountered a deal of sexism.
She is one of the top Philosophers in the world for a reason. You are privileged if you can get into her class.
Great professor, surprisingly knowledgeable.  Sometimes hard to follow--and that's where wikipedia came into play.  Essay exams.  No papers.  Attendance required for lecture and discussion.
Engaging and interesting.
great teacher for sure

She was amazing! I loved going to her class!!!!! She is one of the most interesting women i have ever met and i wish i could have learned more about her. She is incredibly knowledgeable on the subject matter and she and her class really made me think. I can honestly say that her class has changed me tremendously!!!

This ethics course went beyond the standard canon of introductory ethics without comprimising attention to standard texts.  Prof Card was willing to address any questions, and she always did so deftly and with respect.  Very well organized lectures, often with emailed outlines, which helped in test study and discussion.

Professor Card was without a doubt one of the best professors that I have had at this school.  She is a brilliant woman whose knowledge seems to never end.  I highly recommend taking her class to anyone who wants to be challenged.
Quite a disappointment...so dogmatic...so self-righteous...so ****..........the class was more of a personal diatribe than a balanced, equitable dialogue of competing theoires

i learned in her class that marriage is a protection racketeering institution.  women only marry to get protection from other males.  this system mainly benefits the male so his children are watched, the ironing gets done, etc.
I loved her class. I thought it was interesting and well taught. Pretty easy to get a B I felt.
No Comments
